advice.Levels of Tension:
1. Exhausted - Jellyfish
  2. Laid Back - Californian
  3. Neutral - no story
  4. Alert - Curious
  5. Suspense - Melodrama (is there a bomb in the room?)
  6. Passsionate - Opera
  7. Tragic - Petrified
advice.Adam's Date: If you get the audience to laugh, to cry, and to fear for you, you have a good show.
advice.Have Fun: Rule Zero. If you're not having fun, neither is the audience. Have at it.
advice.Yes, And?: Don't deny the reality of the scene. This doesn't mean that you're not allowed to argue, but that the argument should be between the characters: not the actors.
advice.Asking Questions: Try not to ask questions. You know the answers. By adding details you're giving a gift to your partner(s)
